River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Universal’s epic treatment. Allen is also capable of some great moments of humour and he presents a complicated tale as simply and yet intriguingly as possible. Unfortunately there are more flaws here than training shots, but most of these are handled by Allen’s consummate stage and screen chops.
